title: 110_hr4879
content: The Act titled "Virtual Screening for Cancer Act of 2007" includes screening computed tomography colonography as a colorectal screening test for Medicare coverage. The "Virtual Screening for Cancer Act of 2007" adds screening computed tomography colonography as a colorectal screening test for Medicare coverage, with payment consistent with similar services under section 1848. The "Virtual Screening for Cancer Act of 2007" includes screening computed tomography colonography for Medicare coverage, with payment limits specified by the Secretary based on recognized rates for diagnostic procedures. Screening computed tomography colonography can be performed in ambulatory surgical centers with facility payment limits set from January 1, 2008. Payment under this part for services performed in an ambulatory surgical center or hospital outpatient department is based on the lesser of the fee schedule amount for services in a hospital outpatient department or an ambulatory surgical center in the same area. In the case of a beneficiary receiving specified services, the coinsurance amount is limited to 25 percent of the payment amount under the fee schedule. No payment for colorectal cancer screening test if individual is under 50 years of age or if performed within certain time frames after a previous screening. The procedure for colorectal cancer screening should not be performed within specific time frames after a previous screening, as outlined in the Social Security Act. This includes screening colonoscopy, flexible sigmoidoscopy, and computed tomography colonography. The amendments made by this section apply to colorectal cancer screening procedures performed on or after January 1, 2009, including screening colonoscopy, flexible sigmoidoscopy, and computed tomography colonography. The Social Security Act is amended to include screening computed tomography colonography as an exempt imaging service, effective January 1, 2009.
